text: Vilnius Central Railway Station is an LTG Link train station in Vilnius, Lithuania. The railway station is between two neighbourhoods of Vilnius — Naujininkai and Naujamiestis — and on the edge of the Old Town. ==History== The station was opened in 1869 while building the Saint Petersburg–Warsaw Railway. It was destroyed in 1945 during the World War II and in 1950 it was rebuilt in socialist realism style. The station was renovated in 1998 and then again in 2023. ==References== Category:Rail transport in Lithuania Category:Vilnius Category:Railway stations in Europe Category:1861 establishments in Europe Category:Establishments in Lithuania
title: Vilnius railway station
